file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-22-01-04 - APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures for the removal/installation and deactivation/reactivation of the APU shut-off valve. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT WITH WET 28-22-01-000-801-A APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - REMOVAL WINGSTUB ACFT WITH WET 28-22-01-400-801-A APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - INSTALLATION WINGSTUB ACFT WITH DRY 28-22-01-000-802-A APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - REMOVAL WINGSTUB ACFT WITH DRY 28-22-01-400-802-A APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - INSTALLATION WINGSTUB ALL 28-22-01-040-801-A APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - DEACTIVATION ALL 28-22-01-440-801-A APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - REACTIVATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-22-01 Page 1 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-22-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 2. APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions that follow to remove the APU shut-off valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE DEFUELING - SERVICING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 156 156EZ/156DZ Landing gear bay D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Containers To collect residual fuel from the open lines AR available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Landing gear bay I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Defuel the RH fuel tank ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). (2) On the fuel panel, make sure that the XFEED switch is set at OFF. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 2 of 18 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers that follow and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. • APU FUEL SOV. • FUEL CROSS-FEED. (4) Open access panel 156EZ/156DZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the APU shut-off valve. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: USE APPLICABLE CONTAINERS TO COLLECT THE REMAINING FUEL FROM THE OPEN LINES AND KEEP THE WORK AREA CLEAN AND SAFE. (1) Disconnect the electric connector (9) from the APU shut-off valve (1). (2) Remove the bolts (6), spring washers (5) and washers (4). (3) Turn the tube (10) and remove the flange (7). (4) Remove the APU shut-off valve (1). (5) Remove and discard the O-rings (3). (6) Cover all disconnected points with applicable plugs or caps to prevent contamination. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 3 of 18 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB APU Shut-off Valve - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONE 156 A B DET. A (WING STUB REF.) 1 6. BOLT (4x) 5. SPRING WASHER (4x) 4. WASHER (4x) 3. O’RING SUPPORT (REF.) 10. TUBE 7. FLANGE 8. NUT 2 DET. B 9. ELECTRIC CONNECTOR 2. FLANGE 1. APU SHUT-OFF VALVE 1 TORQUE: 2.26 - 2.82 N.m (20 - 25 lb.in) 2 TORQUE: 56.5 - 79.1 N.m (500 - 700 lb.in) EM145AMM280131D.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 4 of 18 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-22-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 3. APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions that follow to install the APU shut-off valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 28-22-00 - AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE REFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-21-11-700-801-A/500 FUEL-FEED-LINE LEAK TEST - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 28-22-01-700-801-A/500 APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - OPERATIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 156 156EZ/156DZ Landing gear bay D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the attachment nuts available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Molykote DC-33 Light Lubricant AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring 28-22-00 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 5 of 18 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Landing gear bay I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Lightly apply Molykote lubricant to the O-rings (5). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers that follow and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. • APU FUEL SOV. • FUEL CROSS-FEED. (3) Remove the protection caps or plugs from the disconnected points, if applicable. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Install the O-rings (3) to the flanges (2) and (7). (2) Install the APU shut-off valve (1) between the flanges (2) and (7). (3) Install the bolts (6), spring washers (5) and washers (4). (4) Turn the tube (10) and install the nut (8) to the flange (7). (5) Tighten the bolts (6) to the flange (2). (6) Install the electric connector (9) on the APU shut-off valve (1). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers that follow and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. • APU FUEL SOV. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 6 of 18 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • FUEL CROSS-FEED. (2) Refuel the RH fuel tank ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300). (3) Do the Fuel-Feed-Line Leak Test ( AMM TASK 28-21-11-700-801-A/500), and examine the APU shut-off valve and connections for leakage. Remove the leakages as necessary. (4) Do the APU shut-off valve adjustment/test ( AMM TASK 28-22-01-700-801-A/500). (5) Do an inspection of the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of the fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Aircraft Maintenance Program. (6) Close access panel 156EZ/156DZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 7 of 18 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-22-01-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB 4. APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the APU shut-off valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE DEFUELING - SERVICING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 192 192BR Center lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Containers To collect residual fuel from open lines 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Center lower fairing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Defuel the RH fuel tank ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). (2) On the fuel panel, make sure that the XFEED switch is set at OFF. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-22-01 Page 8 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. • APU FUEL SOV. • FUEL CROSS-FEED (4) Open access panel 192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the APU shut- off valve. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A WARNING: USE APPLICABLE CONTAINERS TO COLLECT THE REMAINING FUEL FROM THE OPEN LINES AND KEEP THE WORK AREA CLEAN AND SAFE. (1) Remove the bolts (1), spring washers (2), washers (3), (4), and nuts (5). (2) Loosen the nuts (6) and (7). (3) Turn the tube (8) and remove the flange (9). (4) Remove and discard the O-rings (10). (5) Remove the APU shut-off valve (11). (6) Disconnect the electric connector (12) from the APU shut-off valve (11). (7) Cover all disconnected points with applicable plugs or caps to prevent contamination. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-22-01 Page 9 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB APU Shut-off Valve - Removal/Installation Figure 402 A ZONE 192 B C DET. A WING STUB 2 7.NUT DET. B 12. ELECTRICAL 2 6.NUT CONNECTOR 11. SHUT-OFF 9. FLANGE VALVE 8. TUBE 3. WASHER 5.NUT 4. WASHER 2. SPRING WASHER 10. O’ RING DET. C 10. O’ RING 1 1 1. BOLT TORQUE : 2.26-2.82 N.m (20-25 lb.in) 13. FLANGE 2 TORQUE : 56.5-79.1 N.m (500-700 lb.in) 145AMM280088.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-22-01 Page 10 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-22-01-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB 5. APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the APU shut-off valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 28-22-00 - AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE REFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-22-01-700-802-A/500 APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - OPERATIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 192 192BR Center lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the attachment nuts available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Molykote DC-33 Light Lubricant AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring 28-22-00 2 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Center lower fairing EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 28-22-01 Page 11 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-A (1) Lightly apply Molykote lubricant to the O-rings (5). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, make sure that the circuit breakers below are open and with a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag attached to them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. • APU FUEL SOV. • FUEL CROSS-FEED. • Remove the protection caps or plugs from the disconnected points, if applicable. J. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Install the O-rings (10) to the flanges (9) and (13). (2) Install the APU shut-off valve (11) between the flanges (9) and (13). (3) Install the bolts (1), spring washers (2), washers (3) and (4), and nuts (5). (4) Turn the tube (8) and install the nut (6) to the flange (9). (5) Tighten the nuts (6) and (7). (6) Remove the protection cap from the electric connector (12) and connect it to the APU shut-off valve (11). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. • APU FUEL SOV. • FUEL CROSS-FEED. (2) Refuel the RH fuel tank ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 28-22-01 Page 12 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Do the Fuel-Feed-Line Leak Test (AMM TASK 28-22-01-700-802-A/500), and examine the APU shut-off valve and connections for leakage. Correct as necessary. (4) Do the APU shut-off valve adjustment/test (AMM TASK 28-22-01-700-802-A/500). (5) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Aircraft Maintenance Program. (6) Close access panel 192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 28-22-01 Page 13 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-22-01-040-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 6. APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - DEACTIVATION A. General (1) This procedure refers to item 28-22-01 - APU FUEL SHUTOFF VALVE of the DDPM. (2) The aircraft can operate with the APU shut-off valve inoperative if it is secured closed and with the APU not in operation. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995C32 Lockwire AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At valve location I. Deactivation SUBTASK 040-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Open and safety the APU FUEL SOV circuit breaker. (2) Install an "APU FUEL SHUTOFF VALVE INOP - DO NOT USE APU" placard on the APU panel. (3) Get access to the APU shut-off valve. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 14 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Remove, insulate, and stow the electrical connector. (5) Install a protective cap on the electrical connector of the APU shut-off valve. (6) Put the valve position indicator (override lever) in the CLOSED position and safety it with a lockwire. (7) Make an entry in the aircraft technical logbook to show that you did the deactivation procedure for the APU shut-off valve. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 15 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL APU Shut-off Valve - Deactivation Figure 403 LOCKWIRE CLOSED POSITION INDICATOR OPEN EM145AMM281056A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 16 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-22-01-440-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 7. APU SHUT-OFF VALVE - REACTIVATION A. General (1) This procedure refers to item 28-22-01 - APU FUEL SHUTOFF VALVE of the DDPM. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 28-22-01/500 - ADJUSTMENT/TEST C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At valve location I. Reactivation SUBTASK 440-002-A (1) Do the troubleshooting and the applicable corrective maintenance procedure for the APU shut-off valve. (2) Reactivate the APU shut-off valve as follows: (a) Get access to the APU shut-off valve. (b) Remove the protective cap from the electrical connectors. (c) Connect the electrical connector to the APU shut-off valve. (d) Remove the lockwire from the override lever. (e) Remove the "APU FUEL SHUTOFF VALVE INOP - DO NOT USE APU" placard from the APU panel. (f) Close the APU FUEL SOV circuit breaker. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 17 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Make an entry in the aircraft technical logbook to show that you did the reactivation procedure for the APU shut-off valve. (4) Do the APU shut-off valve operational check (AMM MPP 28-22-01/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 28-22-01 Page 18 of 18 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
